keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
keywords.name: organizations

byline.contributor: Charles V. Bagli contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Bill Baroni and Bridget Anne Kelly face federal charges that they participated in a conspiracy to disrupt traffic leading to the George Washington Bridge.

headline.print_headline: 2 Ex-Officials With Ties to Christie Plead Not Guilty in Bridge Scandal
headline.main: 2 With Ties to Christie Plead Not Guilty in Bridge Scandal

snippet: Bill Baroni and Bridget Anne Kelly face federal charges that they participated in a conspiracy to disrupt traffic leading to the George Washington Bridge.
abstract: Bill Baroni, New Jersey Gov Chris Christie's former top staff appointee at Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, and Bridget Anne Kelly, former deputy chief of staff for Christie, plead not guilty to charges that they conspired to disrupt traffic leading to George Washington Bridge.
